sections.title: Prepare for the Non-Monthly Costs
sections.subtitle: Build sinking funds so holidays, travel, and repairs never catch you off guard

sections.title: What You'll Cover
items: List the big but infrequent expenses in your life
Calculate monthly savings targets for each event
Set up sinking funds in your budgeting tool
Create automated reminders so contributions happen on schedule

sections.title: Why Irregular Costs Derail Plans
sections.content: Budgets often fail because they ignore expenses that show up quarterly or once a year. Car maintenance, insurance premiums, holiday gifts, and annual subscriptions are predictable—just not monthly. Sinking funds spread the cost across the year, keeping cash flow smooth.

points.title: Name the Fund
points.description: Give each fund a specific purpose—'Car Maintenance', 'Summer Travel', 'Tech Upgrades'.

points.title: Total the Cost
points.description: Estimate the annual amount based on past spending or realistic research.

points.title: Divide by Months
points.description: Break the cost into monthly contributions and treat them like fixed expenses.

sections.title: Automation Wins
sections.content: Schedule transfers into each sinking fund so you never rely on memory.

sections.title: Where to Store Sinking Funds
sections.content: Use labeled sub-accounts, dedicated savings buckets, or category balances within your budgeting software. Keeping funds separated prevents accidental spending and lets you see progress for each goal.

sections.title: Sinking Fund Builder
steps: List at least six non-monthly expenses you expect in the next 12 months.
Estimate the total cost for each and note the due month.
Divide each total by the number of months remaining until payment.
Add the monthly contribution to your budget under a dedicated category or account.
Set calendar or app reminders 30 days before each expense to double-check the fund balance.

sections.title: Round Up
sections.content: Add a small buffer (5–10%) to each fund. Extra cash rolls into next year's contribution or covers surprise increases.
